channel.title: Pixel Matcher - Find ALL the colors in the client
channel.description:
This script copies the canvas of the client, you can get colors from it and find all the instances of them.
[URL=http://img47.imageshack.us/img47/4232/pixelmatchertk9.png][IMG]http://img47.imageshack.us/img47/4232/pixelmatchertk9.th.png[/img][/URL]
i got the idea from a function in the DTM editor, and i found it Very Useful in making a recent script of mine
1. Drag the crosshair over the client 2. Run the script and press 'Capture' 3. Click the mouse somewhere to retrive colors 4. Press 'Match Pixels' to Highlight everywhere the pixels are found. 5. You can change the tolerance and the color it highlights with.
Enjoy!

item.title: Pixel Matcher - Find ALL the colors in the client
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

well i just used it today for finding the right amount of tolerance

it seems with a tolerance of 68, the color you get with GetSymbolColor(x,y,‘water’) will find the whole drop on the minimap

so it is useful

Read full topic

item.title: Pixel Matcher - Find ALL the colors in the client
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

This script copies the canvas of the client, you can get colors from it and find all the instances of them.

i got the idea from a function in the DTM editor, and i found it Very Useful in making a recent script of mine

  1. Drag the crosshair over the client
  2. Run the script and press ‘Capture’
  3. Click the mouse somewhere to retrive colors
  4. Press ‘Match Pixels’ to Highlight everywhere the pixels are found.
  5. You can change the tolerance and the color it highlights with.

Enjoy!
